Framework
Interface ICore

All Known Implementing Classes:
Core
public interface ICore

ICore implementations provide the core functionality for the top-level aquarium simulation class. Note that the top-level simulation class must implement the simulation loop.

Version:
0.4
Author:
Marc Price

Method Summary
abstract  void addDisplayObject(IDisplayObject displayable)
          METHOD: add a displayable to the world.
abstract  env3d.Env createWorld()
          METHOD: create and initialise the environment (aka 'world')
abstract  void destroyWorld()
          METHOD: destroy the 3D world.
abstract  void removeDisplayObject(IDisplayObject displayable)
          METHOD: remove a displayable from the world.
abstract  void update()
          Apply all updates to the environment.
 

Method Detail

addDisplayObject

void addDisplayObject(IDisplayObject displayable)
METHOD: add a displayable to the world.

Parameters:
displayable - - a displayable of type IDisplayObject

createWorld

env3d.Env createWorld()
METHOD: create and initialise the environment (aka 'world')

Returns:
the 'world', once it has been created.

destroyWorld

void destroyWorld()
METHOD: destroy the 3D world. Although there is a garbage-collector in Java, the world has to be destroyed with 'destroyWorld' in order to close-down your simulation-loop cleanly.

removeDisplayObject

void removeDisplayObject(IDisplayObject displayable)
METHOD: remove a displayable from the world.

Parameters:
displayable - - the displayable of type IDisplayObject to be removed

update

void update()
Apply all updates to the environment. This must be called at the end of each pass through the simulation loop.
